author: .paulharris
content: https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/296 any objections to declaring optional authorize header in the beacon-apis?

author: jgm
content: Should we be defining this as part of the spec itself?  Given that, in general, implementations use HTTP rather than HTTPS then using either system would introduce a security risk.

author: .paulharris
content: fair point, its not 'required' my guess was they watned to run off the ref implementation but haven't asked

author: radekkapka
content:
In the request bodies of the following endpoints:
- https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Validator/getAttesterDuties
- https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Validator/getSyncCommitteeDuties

author: radekkapka
content: Except rewards, there are no other endpoints where you can POST a validator public key in the body of the request

author: sproul
content:
I don’t mind if we remove the pubkey from the request

The other thing we need to tweak is that the response from the attestation rewards endpoint includes an extra redundant list like `data: [{ideal_rewards: .., total_rewards: ..}]`

author: .paulharris
content:
I guess the distinction being the `/validator` endpoints. I'm not fussed either way honestly, but `/beacon` i could imagine calling with a pubkey potentially if you haven't looked it up already, so from a user perspective that may be more useful?
It looks like there's currently 2 use-cases, and they're slightly different, but at least consistent within their sphere.. the question is what we do when a third comes along...

author: .paulharris
content: if we do want to tweak this, can we do it before we do a release?

author: sproul
content: one of the reasons _not_ to accept pubkeys is that the endpoint will only ever return data indexed by validator index, so the client needs to be more careful about returning data in order and without gaps, respecting duplicates, etc. It’s not much harder and we already do this in some other places, but it is a bit annoying
